intro: Lupulus lupuloides var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy hop, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. This variety is notable for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
